The 'puzzles' involved of mkaing the correct choices to get through to the end of all the classmates stories are actually pretty complex, which I thoroughly enjoyed. 38996454.review:
Kindergarten
Que puedo decir de este juego? bueno, bastante

Si estas buscando un juego corto pero con muchos finales y secretos (en este caso serian las tarjetas Monstermon) este juego es de tu agrado

Al comienzo parece un juego de niños no tan interesante, niños de 5 años? por alguna razón hay un aviso antes de entrar a ver el juego (me refiero a la pagina esta, donde compras el juego y ves estos análisis jeje)

En fin, todos los días son lunes, cosa que... Es algo que llama la atención, pero es que depende de los objetos, dinero y acciones que hagas la historia se cambia rotundamente, hay un final por cada compañero, incluyendo la de la profesora y el secreto

Buggs: El niño malo, siempre y esto incluye la vida real siempre hay uno malo del curso
Nugget: El niño que habla en tercera persona y es algo raro
Cindy: La niña mala, no se ve mucho en la vida real esto, ¿o si?
Lily: Una niña bien preocupada por la desaparición de su hermano Billy
Monty: El niño narcotraficante (por decirlo de algún modo)
Jerome: El niño cool (nunca falta uno) e hijo del director

Sra. Applegate: La profesora que le gusta ver peleas
Viejo conserje: Nunca se separa de su trapeador
La cocinera que hace siempre la misma comida (por que siempre es lunes)
El guardia del pasillo (por decirlo de algún modo)
El director: No diré nada de el

Y por supuesto: Tu

¿Ya dije que todos incluyéndote tienen solo 5 años?

El objetivo es simple, completa todos los finales, ¿Fácil? No lo creo

Se requiere lógica y repetir una y otra ves las mismas acciones, por que si te equivocas en algo u olvidar, no podrás completar dicha misión

Yo me lo complete al tercer día, la cual eso me dice que juegos así son lo mio, me encanto, casi 10 horas en completarlo al 100% (básicamente para ver cada uno de los posibles diálogos que hay, incluye muertes, llevare un 95% de todos los diálogos más o menos)

Se los recomiendo muchísimo, ni vean gameplays por Youtube u otro medio (si te lo completaste bueno, como guste jeje) ya que es mejor jugarlo y ver las múltiples charlas que se encuentran en cada personaje en cada momento del día

Completar cada final es desde una reacción normal y corriente hasta algo épico

----- ¡¡¡A PARTIR DE ACÁ HAY POSIBLE SPOILER!!! -----

Si es cierto que de toda un gran juego tiene sus cositas y de eso quiero hablar ahora

Me encuentro jugando la versión 1.45 (hoy)

Buggs, digo, Bugs: No es tan grande ni que afecte, de echo no afecta, pero si te encuentras en la misión de Jerome, cuando este habla con la cocinera, puedes momerte en ese entonces, si te vas a afuera que te deja, cuando Jerome este volviendo causara un error en el código que no te dejara moverte, se resuelve reiniciando ese momento del día
Hay otro que me paso que se me quedo la profe en la puerta en el salón, y si ahí haces lo de Jerome, bueno, la profe no vuelve al lugar que le corresponde, no afecta, pero si cuenta

Tarjetas Monstermon: Nada mal, bien echo, las sugerencias estaban bien echas, salvo que, dos de esas pienso y creo que están mal echas
Hay una que es "pelea con Buggs y síguelo por el pasillo hasta su escondite", esa no es que este mal, salvo que no dice justamente en que momento, como, o donde, por que resulta que tienes que conseguir el cuchillo haciendo la misión de Nugget y en ves que este coma el Nugget tienes que usar el cuchillo, sin duda tuve que ver en un video donde era el lugar que se hace eso (no vi todos los pasos, solo ese). Seria más fácil si dijese "pelea con Buggs y hacele daño durante la comida" solo eso y ya esta, no más datos
Hay otro que es "darle el pase del vestíbulo al conserje", hubiese sido mejor si dijera "en el baño", solo eso y nada más, ya que es difícil llegar a ese dialogo en el baño porque no esta a simple vista o cerca

Y por ultimo las faltas ortográficas y otros: Si prestas atención, veras en sugerencias que hay dos de las cartas que están juntas con el mismo nombre
Durante el juego también se ven errores ortográficos
Quiero resaltar que algunos diálogos no están bien expresados, no molesta mucho, pero si un poco
También hay una frase no traducida que es la de cuando agarras 3 cosas de tu cuarto

----- ¡¡¡FIN SPOILER!!! -----

Conclusión: me encanto, siento que habrá una segunda parte asegurada, la esperare con ansias, sin duda es una experiencia única, y solo hablando de que son de 5 años

Pd: El final de Lily y el secreto son los mejores, juro que una lagrima solté en ambos, y eso que no me pasa nunca. No nos olvidemos que algunas cartas de Monstermon me dejo impactado con lo que paso. Ej: Auto

38757282.review:
[b] Tldr [/b] : You need a sense of dark humor, thick skin to gore, and some patience in order to fully enjoy this game, and if you do, this game won't disappoint.

If you're okay with dark humor and gore, you'll definitely enjoy Kindergarten. This is the main criteria as the player you have to fulfill in order to fully enjoy this game, and I really did love the experience. So much to the point where I played at least 8 hours straight to trying to finish the story.

One important thing to know before purchasing this game is dialogue decisions are very important and the game has to be picky in order for you to trigger new actions/dialogue. After a certain point, maybe even only a good 15 minutes of trial and errror, there will be a lot of skipping dialogue since you would've memorized it by then. I recommend also having a good amount of patience because it can and will get tedious after a while of trying and failing.

Another thing to keep in mind is this is a trial and error game, and you need to fail [i] a lot [/i] for you to learn. You'll get a whole lot of interesting endings, but patience is a virtue with this game. I found myself restarting rooms and even days for forgetting a step, but honestly, I didn't mind too much.

This trial and error system of the game is also aided with the hints the developers where smart and kind enough to add. The hints are very helpful because they direct you into storylines after you've experienced several trials. The hint system almost negates the use of outside sources/walkthroughs and makes the game substantially easier to complete. I only really needed outside help past the storylines and more for gaining collectibles/Monsterman cards.

Just to end on the highs of this game, Kindergarten is true to the trailer and goes way beyond that. The trailer only gives you a taste of the gore and the hilariously morbid dialogue you'll find in this game, and the stories are actually completely fun to do (Lily's is the most interesting). Don't be afraid to fail just to see the dialogue because you'll still get a laugh or an oh-wow moment, and enjoy your neverending loop of Monday horrors.

38686630.review:
Kindergarten is an interesting game in which your choices matter. There are numerous outcomes to each action, and it's fun to fart around and see where your actions will take you. Most often, they lead to gruesome deaths, but every once in a while, everything works out. For the record, I died within the first 30 seconds of playing my first game, but that didn't discourage me one bit. In fact, I found it amusing. This also immediately showed me how to progress - you make mistakes, then learn not to do that action again.

This is a surpisingly complex and enjoyable game. Each character has his/her own "quest" line, which require specific actions. The game also offers hints that are nice to help you figure out what to do next, although it can be a little annoying when you make one wrong move and are forced to start the day over. Regardless, I got six quality hours of play time out of it, and the achievements were fairly easy to acquire, with a bit of patience.

Highly recommended for a quick, fun game.

38360370.review:
In this game, you play as a Kindergartener, and you try to complete every one of your classmates', including other's, story lines. It's fun when you figure out how to get a certain character to do something without dying, or when you get access to a different room after seeing it every day. The characters are really good too! Of course they're not amazing, I mean, it's based off of Kindergarten, but they're still likeable and funny! The graphics are sort of a 16 bit style, and are just mediocre through the whole game. The music is AMAZING! There isn't much, but I still hum the main theme to this day!

But that's about all the positives I have for this game. There are a few negatives.

For one, you can't delete a save file. Since the day resets, it appeares that there's no issue with it, but your money doesnt reset! That means that you have to keep going to school, getting money, and killing yourself until you have max. Also, once you complete a character's story line, you get an achievment and an item, and that's it. This may not seem like a big deal, but I HIGHLY suggest using a walkthrough for this game, because it is almost impossible to figure everything out. Some, of course, are easier than others, but if you get really stuck on a character, just look up a YouTube video to help yourself. My final complaint is the Monsterman Cards. Throughout the game, there are collectible cards. Some cards are EXCLUSIVE to a character's story line. On my first run, I beat the game without grabbing Monsterman Cards, but if I want to FULLY beat the game, I have to play through each character's story again. In my opinion, it's not worth it.

Overall, I HIGHLY recommend this game, but keep in mind, collect the Monsterman Cards on your first run, and if you cannot finsih a character's story line, then use YouTube. That's why this game got so popular, it's because everyone was looking for help on this game on the internet.

38322690.review:
It's a fun simplistic game.  You go through a constant rinse and repeat experience, and try to line up scenarios to obtain Monster Cards, and experience some gruesome deaths, and see others experience them too.  It can be a lot of trial and error, but fun to just sit down and play if you're chilling out, or just want something to play for 5 minutes. It can be a little repetitive, but for 4.99, it's not bad and does provide a laugh here and there.  Only issue I had was the controls. At times, sometimes the controls would either lock up, or some actions would not respond unless I press pause and resume.

Recommend.   

7/10

那么，作为非常经典，自由度颇高的解密游戏，在前期还是相当让人眼前一亮——各种稀奇古怪的死法[spoiler]指出清洁工手里拿着的不是拖把就死了这个也就算了所有的游戏介绍都无一例外用它来开场，可是为什么校长可以随随便便在办公室掏枪啊，以及打cindy线我好不容易泡到了cindy，结果掉过头就被某个小孩当着老师的面活活打死，老师还一个劲儿叫“哦我喜欢这个”是什么鬼！！！！变态幼儿园吗我要投诉！！！[/spoiler]以外，还可以用各种方式探索这个学校——只要你不怕死，不管是自己死还是别人死——就没有什么不可以。前期我尝试各种不同的组合来尽可能多地获得线索，可以说是玩得相当尽兴。
可以说是值回票价了。
然后就到了中期，中期的时候玩家基本已经获得了所需的线索，毕竟就算自己想不到，游戏里的hints栏也是相当地和蔼可亲[spoiler] 所以为什么你们的任务栏消失得那么快，根本还没有来得及看清就不见惹！！[/spoiler]只要玩家英语水平不是太差，都可以推出所需的步骤。那么，就是进行反复地组合试错，争取在每一次5个行动轮中尽可能地达成目标了。
所以在中期，其实略微有一点点沉闷无聊……这个游戏的存档机制导致你只能选择restart the room／restart the day，如果你在一天的最后环节才反应过来，早上的时候应该做某个事情才能彻底完成今天的事件的话，那么就只能重新开始一天了。虽然对于老单机玩家，尤其是刷成就的单机玩家来说，这点工作量根本不算什么。但我是已经被很多新游戏宠坏了，[strike] 再也没有了当年仙剑1没有地图地在将军冢迷路8个小时的毅力[/strike]。所以我，去看了，攻略。
每个人的线做得还挺可爱的，让人觉得不管是开门要钱[spoiler] 不给钱就捅死我喂你好过分的！！！[/spoiler]的小坏蛋，还是那个[spoiler] 一周有六个男朋友但因为最后给我花花说我是她最好的男朋友于是我迅速屈服觉得她好可爱诶[/spoiler]的cindy，[spoiler] 其实是最终boss但人家大智若愚并且一心保护着好朋友billy[/spoiler]的小笨蛋，用鼻孔看人根本没有什么可以打黑码的校长儿子，还有脑子超级好用但[spoiler] 可能会因为管不住自己的嘴而被主角搞死[/spoiler]的财迷老斗，加上代表最终谜题，[spoiler] 全作最无辜如果说天要打雷理论上是最不该死但不知道为什么她就是死了的[/spoiler] lily，可以说是非常迷人又可爱了。
[strike] 其实我也可以理解女教师想要早下班的心情。[/strike] 
[b]我也想要早下班。[/b]
[u] 请制作组开发游戏company，我一人血书请愿。[/u] 
20块钱以内可以说是值回票价了，我也确实没有更多的期待。玩得很开心，就不想讨论这个游戏里面有人没有人生意义这样的事情。毕竟游戏，最重要的一点就是让人开心——
所以圣诞节这个游戏会打折吗，我已经把它推荐给很多朋友了诶！

最后是几个可能剧透的tips：
[spoiler] 1. 去储物室找东西的时候，一定要留一个苹果的行动机会，不然肯定会遭遇疯狂清洁工。
2. 其实并不一定要按网上攻略才能打出cindy线物品，她反复提到自己的狗，而我们都能猜得出狗狗是谁杀的——你只要能够将它证明给cindy看就好了（这是朋友和我说的，不排除他口胡可能，待测试）
3. 把偷来的东西（比如校长的，比如老师的）展示给老师看不会有什么好结果的，哥们儿，biu地一枪
4. 但是什么也不带去参加展示环节，依旧会让你见校长。见校长，biubiu。
5. 储物室左下角的箱子里有钱，但是要找对拿钱的角度。
6. 当你让老师不开心的时候，不要和老师吃饭饭——想什么呢，你怎么能小看这个你在被痛殴的时候只是在旁边围观的倒霉老师——当然也不要在兜里揣着炸弹的前提下引爆炸弹。会bomb的。
7. cindy的狗狗线可能需要在cindy高好感前提下，能去nugget的地洞（也就是早上要从他那里获得一块炸鸡），同时午餐的时候反复逼问清洁工那个biscuit ball是什么玩意儿，是否必须去盥洗室调查袋子则是未知……我估计行动轮可能不够。
8. 20块钱很好攒，老师送给你的午餐券（4块，要早餐时间卖掉），被nugget送到办公室拿药（5块，上课时间卖掉），和校长儿子拿通行卡（5块，可以顺便在储物间左下角箱子里拿钱，消磨一下苹果，回来校长儿子就来不及找你要通行卡了，但小心不要被清洁工袭击），箱子里的钱（5块），再随便enter一下苹果，加上早上带的钱就够了。也可以帮cindy粘口香糖到lily头发上，中午领任务，下午玩游戏的时候粘，再去找cindy拿一块钱（这很过分哦）记得要带东西去参加展示环节，不然会被崩。清洁工房间的血桶不会让你进校长办公室，可是这样你很可能凑不到20块钱。所以一般我会选择monster card，耶～[/spoiler]

가격에 비해서 괜찮은 게임입니다
유치원에서 유치원생들과 관리인과 선생과 원장이 서로 죽고 죽이는 즐거운 내용이라는 점도 괜찮음에 한 몫을 더하고 있구요
이런 게임이 그렇듯 스토리는 사실상 아무 내용이 없다고 보시면 됩니다 (다른 평가에서 스토리가 좋다고 해서 좀 거대한 병맛스토리를 기대하기도 했는데 역시 그런거 없구요)
스토리는 신경쓰지 않고 단서를 찾아 문제를 해결하는 방식의 게임을 좋아한다면 재밌게 할 수 있을 것 같네요
게임도 나름 친절해서 처음에 인터페이스 설명 다 해주고 게임 내에 힌트 메뉴도 있습니다
문제는 힌트 내용이 너무 단순해서 결국 선택지를 다 골라보는 시행착오를 거쳐야만 해결할 수 있는데 이 과정이 은근히 짜증납니다
똑같은 내용을 계속 반복하는거라 카드 모을 때쯤엔(루트 중간에 카드 모으기를 왜 막아놓은건지 모르겠네요
그런 식으로 일부러 플레이 타임 늘려봤자 똑같은 내용 또 보는거라 빡치기만 할 뿐인데) 무척 지루해집니다
그래도 다 보았다 싶어도 무궁무진한 선택지와 이벤트가 있어서 나름 할만한 시도는 다 했다고 생각했는데
공략을 보니 모르고 있던 방법도 꽤 있더라고요
저는 32번째 월요일을 반복할쯤 망할 예~소리와 띵띠딩띵띵띵하는 배경음악만 들어도 미칠 것 같아서 그만뒀지만요
병맛이라고 해도 플레이어가 직접 npc들을 때려잡을 수는 없어서 무척 아쉬웠습니다

부디 킨더가든2에서는 게임완료 보상으로 총을 주길 바랍니다. 다 쏴죽여버리게.

37864372.review:
It is a good game with a really cool idea of looping Mondays. Mondays are usually a horror (more like a meme) among students because they mean weekend's over and time for school again. In the game, the Kid have to loop his Mondays, which can be pretty scary. However, this game is not scary to play. Sure, there is much gore but it's not as horrifying as monsters from other games like Re7 and Until Dawn. Anyway, I really like the game and how different characters develop their personalities. You get to know more of them bit by bit by completing missions given by each of them. There are consequences in the game as well, like, will you be able to survive for a whole day and collect stuff you need in order to do the final missions(ie. Lily's/Nugget's ALTERNATE)? I am hoping if there will be any DLCs in the future to keep the game living.

Love this game so much. V. glad that one of my friends recommended me this game. <3

37012542.review:
Warning: This review will contain full spoilers. If you don't wish to have spoilers, do not read this review.

If you don't care, go ahead and read.




"Kindergarten" is a very short game. It only took me around 2 hours to 100% complete the game (get all achievements). 

If you're a fan of Groundhog Day and kids, you'll likely like this game. Because it's basically Groundhog Day with kids.

The story of Kindergarten is this: 
It's your first day of Kindergarten and when you get there, you meet your fellow classmates, the creepy janitor and your teacher. 
One of the girls is called Cindy and is a bit of a psycho. So let's start with her story. 

When you encounter Cindy, she will ask if you want to be her boyfriend. Sure. Why not. 
She tells you that to become her boyfriend, you have to do something for her. Namely stick some gum in another girl's hair (called Lily) during morning class. Okay then...

During morning, stick the gum in Lily's hair. Lily will start crying. Report to Cindy.

Cindy will be overjoyed at this fact and ask you to play House with her. 
Well, that seems innocent eno---
Cindy: "Have you been drinking?"
Oh. 
Piss her off enough and you'll have to pay her $1 to get off your case.
If you don't, she'll stab you in the face with a knife. Hell if I know where she hid it.

If you manage to succeed in not getting stabbed in the face, it's now time for lunch.

During lunch, she wants something vegan to eat. But being a 6 year old moronic kid, she has no idea what 'vegan' means. You can either give her a Biscuit or a Salad you can buy for $0.75 from another kid (who I call "Money Loving Brat"). 
Give her either and she'll ask you to break into the Janitor's closet and get a bucket of blood. 
Yeah. We're re-enacting Stephen King's "Carrie" here. 

During recess, speak to Cindy again. She'll ask you to dump the blood on Lily. She jumps down a giant hole to take suicide. Shortly after, a boy called Nugget does the same due to not having any friends. 
Do so and you'll get a flower for show and tell. 
During show and tell, show the flower. Cindy becomes overjoyed and asks you to keep the flower. 

That's the end of the Monday.

Second day: Monday again. It's always Monday. You can never escape it. 



Nearly all of the characters in the game has ways of killing you. 
It ranges from beating you to death for snitching on the teacher, getting shot in the face for not bringing something to Show and Tell, getting stabbed for being a drunk during House, getting poisoned by a Poisoned Nugget or even getting killed by the creepy Janitor for hanging in his room when lunch break ends.


Every time you complete a day with a specific person, you get certain items. Said items are needed to complete the game.
The items ranges from the flower from Cindy, a special Lunch Pass from your teacher (do note that eating it during a specific route causes you to die. Because it's poisoned. You can also just stab your teacher if you want to. I mostly brought it to sell for $3 during the Morning).

Overall, the game is short, fairly difficult because you have to constantly be aware of what you're meant to do and not. One screw up and you have to re-do the entire room.

Oh and I wasn't joking about dying if you didn't bring anything to Show and Tell.
You'll be sent to the Principal's Office, who shoots you, because kids who won't bring anything to Show and Tell will be failures later in life. Pretty much.

But yeah. I'd recommend buying the game. It's cheap (and I bought it at 20% off) but it's VERY easy to screw up on. At least the achievements are fairly easy (except the final one. That one is mostly just tedious, but not flatout hard).

36101920.review:
This game is beautiful. I wasn't sure what to expect, but I took a risk. I can't speak well enough about this game. 

The game mechanics are smooth - graphics hold up and game items are easy to see
The characters are fun with unique dialogs and motivations.
A sense of accomplishment after finally getting all the in-game achievements
Difficulty is solid. It's not too easy. But it definitely isn't too difficult to beat. It's perfect.

Game Play: You are a kindergartner. You have varying quests and need to interact with different characters at different times to accomplish your missions. Not only do you have multiple endings to your "day at school" but there is an in-game mini-game to find all the hidden "cards" around the game world.

I admit there was a period where I was frustrated and the game became repetitive. But, once I got past it, everything became golden again.

If you have a good sense of humor, enjoy easy-going yet challenging puzzles, mixed with the love for "choose-your-own adventure" type games, this is an easy decision. Grab this game! 

I wish there were more games like this.

* I don't know how to receive a free edition of #2 to help test it out but, if it's possible, I'd love to be in on that! Major props to Con Man Games and SmashGames on this game!

The puzzles are a little challenging, but not too challenging, and it's the sort of game where you can figure out just about everything if you've tried enough times.  10/10, makes me nostalgic for my childhood when the cafeteria food had no nutritional value and my principal was out to get me.

35562973.review:
"Don't ask how, just f*cking figure it out."
- The Lonely Island - Go Kindergarten

Kindergarten is a great comedy game that's somewhat impeded by its clunky mechanics. It's another quirky indie puzzle/adventure. The gameplay isn't special. As a matter of fact, I think the Apple System of limited actions for each room only exist to artificially inflate the game's playtime, because a lot of the solutions to each quest are completed by trial-and-error learning. It's pretty frustrating to get to the end of the day, only to learn that there was one step you missed because you didn't know anything about it. That said, it's not too time consuming to start over.

What makes this game worth it is that it's balls-to-the-wall silly. Almost all the dialogue, characters, and events are treated as opportunities for goofy, unusual, or violent humor. It's very much like early South Park, which is the best praise I can give it.

7/10

35515933.review:
Kindergarten is a game where you play achild that has started at a new school that is completely corrupt and definitily fictional. You are instantely involved into this massive scene about gaining friends, discovering truths and learning about your new school. Be prepared as you a brought through a gore filled rollercoaster of wierd people and even wierder basements as you learn the truth of the schools missing child. getting your thinking caps on because this ones gonna get hard and make you really use that educated brain.

GRAPHICS: The art style of this game is very nice and what i call "fake old". It reminds me alot of a game like the binding of Isaac due to to the way it is presented in its 2d matter. The characters have a very unique astableshment and make you assume the way they sound durin the dialoge. Due to the games graphics simplicity this is an extremely simple game to run and does not require a very "high tech" computer at all.

NEGATIVE SEGMENT: Although this is an extremely fun game at times it can be very difficult to cope with, you can spend 30 minutes just looking for one object/ending that can be really obvious in the end. The aspect of clues isnt as helpful as you would hope and dosnt help with making you not want to uninstall at times. I finished the base game and now have to acomplish collecting all the monstermon cards to get the special ending. This is taking massive amounts of time and patience and has gotten me close to giving up and uninstalling the game. The dialogue is somewhat unclear at some points but mostly good, i feel that mabye the developers have done that on purpose to make characters destinct but it can sadly make the game hard to follow at some points. The glitches in this game (which there can be alot of) can be easily avoidable but expected due the game beeing quite low project in my opinion, If you get affected by a glitch you usually have to restart the day which can be so annoying/frustrating but will most likely be avoidable the next time. 

POSITIVE SEGMENT: After reading the last segment your probably surprised why i actually reccomend this game but i will tell you why this game is a must buy for anybody. The game has alot of features that we dont see alot in recent games and is sooo refreshing. This is a game that i could come home too after a long day and just enjoy it, That might also come as a suprise due to the sheer gore in this game but its suprisingly mellow if you choose it to be. At some points yes it is extremely frustrating but thats only if you choose it to be. If you just hang on to it and go through the proccess you can come out with it being very exciting and fun. I obviosly chose for myself to get angry over it but i relise now that if i just went through the proccess without showing so much anger i would have enjoyed it even more than i did. I sounded like i hated the game last segment due to the fact that that my problems where only for some points in the game and most of the time it was just alot of fun. The amount of role and characterisation put into each character was astonoshing for instance nugget was an outcast, he was different due to his "nerdiness" and his involvment in chicken nuggets. He is a very dark person and has alot of anger and grief due to his friends death. This u can tell through the imagry, dialogue and plot of the game. Each character is so different and have a completely different role to the others. It really shows how much work the developers put into the game in that aspect and allowes you to enjoy it that much more. The plot, setting and scene of the game is very good to. we have a very dark plot filled with drama and emotion. The idea of this corrupt, bad school as the scene adds so much more context to the school and fills you with some sense of connection to the game in your own weird way by the end. There is alot of room for improvment but constant updates and bug fixes really overpowers that.

CONCLUSION: This game is very fun, gory and dark but adds alot of enjoyment and entertainment to your games library. I definately reccomend this to someone looking for a fun and affordable game to give them a nice fix or even as a weird occasional game u might play after a long day.

special rating: 9/10  Date: 6th of October 2017

35208320.review:
I love the premise and gameplay, but cannot in good faith recommend this implementation. The hint system exists to compensate for the game's greatest flaw: many solutions, clues, and actions in the game are available for only a single "step" during the day, and if you miss them, you're hosed. Even when you know what to do, you don't know exactly when and where to do it.  

If the game were polished to the point where the hint system was no longer necessary, it would have my enthusiastic endorsement.

首先得感谢阿普尔盖特[spoiler] 乳摇	[/spoiler]小姐的回信[spoiler] （以及最后令人背后发麻的结语）	[/spoiler]，她已经对本评测起了非常重要的作用，也对我们揭露幼儿园背后的阴谋提供了指向。但可惜的是，阿普尔盖特[spoiler] 乳摇	[/spoiler]小姐好像并不在意怪兽卡片在幼儿园中发挥的作用。
而我的建议是：请多多收集卡片吧！
[h1] 现在，是真正的评测：	[/h1]《幼儿园》，在不断地轮回中抽丝剥茧，直到发现最后的真相
《幼儿园》的画面虽然简陋，但实际描绘的是一场又一场超越画面本质的阴谋。其丰富的机会机制和人物对话中暗藏的蛛丝马迹都实实在在地展现了这个外表并不特殊的幼儿园中潜藏着某些不可告人的秘密。
每一个线索的添加都预示着玩家离真相越来越接近，而至于能走多远，则取决于玩家能否在重试中收获经验以及保持着再来一次的勇气。
其次，《幼儿园》作为一款解密类游戏，其谜题并不会对玩家产生过多的刁难[spoiler]（非解密专业玩家也能轻松游玩）	[/spoiler]在谜题量充足与连贯的前提下又能让玩家融入剧情，并且谜题布置的合情合理，循序渐进，不至于出现严重的断篇断层，不知所措的现象。
再者，是行动点数的设定。这规定了在特定场景中玩家只能精确地计算自己的行动步骤完成规定的事项，一旦做了多余的事那很可能导致一步出错，步步出错的局面[spoiler] （这时候就好好攒钱，咱明日再战）	[/spoiler]在增加难度的同时也提高了游戏乐趣和反复开始的动力[spoiler] （不过因此而导致的断片断层现象真的难以解决）	[/spoiler]

[spoiler] 什么？你问我克总在哪？嘘~阿普尔盖特乳摇小姐看着呢，她可不能知道这件事。[/spoiler]
[spoiler] 只能告诉你，结局有惊喜。	[/spoiler]

经过漫长的奋斗，成就指南也终于完成可喜可贺可喜可贺！http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1143337456

当你闲来无事时，可以打开这款《幼儿园》来品尝游戏世界中的另类故事，好好热爱生活，保持初心  [spoiler]  就算是害人的初心也一样 （笑 	[/spoiler]

35127994.review:
Hi Kids! Do you like violence? Want to get shot, stabbed, poisioned, blown up, and impaled on a mop? Then boy howdy, do you want Kindergarten. 

Kindergarten is a puzzle adventure leading you through the trecherous world of elementry school with adorable pixel graphics, clear goals, and a bouncy soundtrack of only three songs. If you're old like me and remember games like Leisure Suit Larry, Police Quest, and Hero's Quest, you'll feel right at home as you try to figure out how to solve everyone's problems without getting horrific murdered at every turn. Though the game doesn't have much replay value once you've beaten it, it's worth it to make friends! Get hints! Collect Monstermon cards! Mostly, just survive!

Kindergarten is just awesome. I'ts clever, funny and even challenging at times. It definitely goes into my "best indie games of the year" list.

Figuring out how to ahcieve each goal - how to complete each quest - led to some very funny moments and interesting discoveries.

While the game is single-player only, you can play with a friend. I personally played it with my wife, and it was very entertaining to try and work out the solution together, and see the often horrible outcome of our attempts.

This one isn't for the faint of heart, but if you're looking for a unique puzzle game that packed with dark humor - you have to play Kindergarten.

All I have to say is that this game is great. Its quirky humour is worth the price of the game alone. I probably played longer than most as I enjoyed seeing all the outcomes and jokes your own elimination brings (and I had some trouble with the monster cards which I'll mention in a moment). All in all it's a fairly playable game. It's not exactly super easy but you do get rewarded with hints and plot points with every time you fail your quest for friendship. The only thing that caused me some trouble was getting a handful of the harder monstermon cards. Some of it made sense others were hard to guess even with the hints. I was worried that the payoff wouldn't be worth the couple hours it took for me to find them all but the secret ending was worth it. It's not the funniest joke and is more akin to trolling but I had a good laugh out of it personally. 

All and all you should really get this game, it's a great thing to whittle away at for several hours and the quirky style is just fabulous.

34679231.review:
[h1]Kindergarten[/h1]
You play as a kindergarten student and experience a day at Kindergarten. You get to do typical stuff that everyone used to do in kindergarten, such as… making friends, taking part in show and tell, playing house, getting the crap beaten out of you by the school bully, finding out what happened to the missing student, and talking to Nugget!

[b]Pros[/b]
+ An amazing story that will keep you playing for ages
+ Great characters that are very likeable and memorable
+ It’s quite funny
+ The puzzles are really well made and are fun to do
+ The artwork for the game is really well done
+ It has really high replay value
+ Great music
+ Its pretty cheap ($4.99 USD)

[b]Cons[/b]
- Nothing! Kindergarten is THAT great of a game!

Overall, Kindergarten is an amazing game and I’m looking forward to Kindergarten 2. I highly recommend this game.

34543603.review:
This game is f***ed up. In a great way. Imagine "Groundhog's Day" meets "Happy Tree Friends", and you'll be getting close. 

You are a student in a kindergarten class, trying to figure out what the bloody hell is going on. Every day consists of helping a kid solve their story-quest, mostly through trial and error. But, at the end of the day, the world resets except for the special unlockable magic items. Death is very common so get used to it. 

The real gem of this game is the dialogue. It's full of weird twists and disturbing back stories that never really explain themselves, but you're sure that it isn't normal. Contrast that with the child-like animation and music, and the game becomes a one of a kind indie experience. The biggest downside is the trial and error problem; where screwing up something means that you end up taking the same dialogue path over and over. It's not bad, just frustrating. 

Overall, the game is a bargain. Pick it up and expect a few hours of surreal violence in a charming choose-your-own-adventure skin.

这个游戏作为一个小型休闲的解谜游戏有着独特的魅力，故事围绕幼儿园小朋友们发生的[strike]日常[/strike][spoiler]非科学黑色剧情[/spoiler]进行展开，解开了一个又一个人物的内心[strike]真实[/strike]世界。逻辑性完整，又有着诙谐的对话风格，但其实整体内容偏压抑。整个游戏有九种结局。[spoiler]除了主线HAPPY ENDING，其余均视为BD也不为过，还有最后的TRUE ENDING有点点俗套。[/spoiler]应该会有二作。
值得一玩，不过因为这游戏回想童年，国内的幼龄教育似乎很安全啊，笑。

This game was a fucking trip. I've now 100% the game, and as you can see, it only took me a little less than 6 hours.
Honestly, I would say that if you think you'll like this game, get it. If you're on the fence, wait to see if it goes on sale.

Pros:
-Cute Art style makes the... Shenanigains, yea that's what I'll call it, the sheninigains far easier to stomach for those who are squeamish (like me), as well as just being good in general
-Very interesting story and generally fun gameplay
-The characters are quite interesting and all around great to listen to
-The puzzles are logical and generally fun, allowing use of some creative thinking to find solutions
-The fucking collectable cards are hilarious, enough said.

Cons:
-The trial and error can get old fast, especially for the trickier routes, and I only got about halfway through before just pulling up a guide because I didn't feel like guessing anymore. The game gives you a hint system, but some hints are only unlocked after you've already figured out wha the hint tells you, or at least, that's when I got them.
-The dialouge tends to get repetitive due to the day being the same each time. Unfortunately, I feel this is more an issue with the way the game is formatted rather than the writing in and of itself.
-There's no real payoff, or at the very least, the payoff is not all that satisfying. You find out what's going on at the school, yes, but it doesn't explain the kill-happy staff and other issues the school seems to have. The secret ending isn't all that good either, as it's surprisng and somewhat entertaining, but not enough to make up for the fact that it's a blatant sequel hook.
-Not much in the way of replayability. Once you've gotten all the endings and collected all the cards, there's really nothing to do. The Cards aren't exactly replayability in itself as they (usually) only require one small task or another.

It may seem like I hate this game, but I don't, I love it a lot actually. It's got some issues, but for five dollars, it was well worth the money, in my opinion, and I would highly reccommend it if you think it'd be something you'd like. Just be prepared for some trial/error and don't be afraid to pull out a guide if something is elluding you. Hopefully, if this game does indeed get a sequel, they can take the experience and improve upon the problems I mentioned above.

首先汉化用的游侠的，样式崩是最大的毛病，有错译漏译的现象，3DM的不知道。

这个游戏用了汉化会好玩一些。

游戏最大的问题主要还是重复流程的过程中过于乏味（没有跳过或者说没有即时读档）。全成就5个小时搞定，因为之前看人玩过一部分，所以上手比较快（其实就是把自己的三观搞得变态一点），刚接触游戏的话估计时间翻个倍不是问题~~

游戏最出彩的地方应该就是角色之间的对话文案脚本了。从字里行间中，我们能体会到游戏中所有角色在人性上的肮脏以及心理上的扭曲（除了Lily，包括主角）。游戏中不存在多余的对话，不同选项必定会引向不同的结果，甚至是最后的展示课上，出示的物品不同，解决也会有影响。

另一点不爽的在于时间的判定，游戏中通过【苹果】来限制主角的行动数，但在部分剧情中，就算苹果还有剩，也会强制判定场景结束，这一点主要在收集卡片的时候很烦人。

Decent game; fun with a nice art style.

At first, you'll just be going round aimlessly. It's kind of fun figuring out what your objectives are and how to do them (or if you even have any).

Great replay value with many endings, only downside is that it can really take the piss to get a specific ending. You have to do the entire day a dozen or so times doing mostly the same thing over and over. I'd reccomend just taking it slow though and not going for a certain ending. Just try everything you can and you'll find links between things naturally.

Wouldn't buy if you're impatient or can't stand repetition.
Would *definitely* buy if you're a fan of the point and click puzzle genre.

34281102.review:
This game accurately represents how most kindergarteners felt during their first year of school (well, unless they went to preschool). No friends, a teacher who never gives you as much attention as your parents, and an overactive imagination...unless everything you're seeing wasn't imaginary.

The game also provides very interesting gameplay, with a variety of missions and death screens to keep you on your toes. And if you want the all the monstermon cards? Well, looks like you're going to be Cindy's boyfriend for a very long time. I loved figuring out the patterns and overlap. Once you finally collect all the key items, you unveil a sinister yet strange plot and even then you probably haven't explored every mission variant.

It's simple and sadistic. A classic that I recommend.

34189538.review:
This game is like Groundhog Day meets Hitman.

You are the new kid in the Kindergarten and your actions influence how the day progresses for everyone.

At the end of the day you have learned new information or gained items, the kids forgot everything that happened, and the whole cycle repeats.

You will leave a bloody trail (literally), which culminates in a grand-finale, revealing the secret that haunts everyone in this place.


The puzzles are fun and with roughly 5-6 hours of play time it can be solved in a single evening.

34109941.review:
This game is different. The way I try to 'sell' this game to my friends is, "It's like if the tasks in Majora's Mask to help people were it's own game, but mixed with the movie Groundhog Day." 
It's Monday and you're the new kid in a school where bad stuff goes on, it's always Monday. The day is split into around five different segments, each with their own set of objectives. Each segment is a different part of the school day and each subsequent segment has objectives that differ depending on how you interact with the other students/faculty. At the end of the day you may be rewarded with a special item for your actions, along with collectible cards and money are the only things that carry over. Everything else is just as it was on Monday, your first day of school.

This game is essentially a flowchart. You don't play this game to enjoy the mechanics, you play it to ferret out just another hidden line of great dialogue. It's a maze where every turn leads to something genuinely funny, albeit probably game-ending.

33978800.review:
[h1]Kindergarten[/h1]
Didn't think it would be as good as the description described it, but damn. 
I changed my mind after a few [b]minutes[/b] playing it. Bought It with a thought in my mind telling me that I would be one of "those games" that you would get bored of but little did I know, I was wrong. Kindergarten is honestly one of the best games I've played so far and It's [u]definitely worth the money[/u].

[h1]The gameplay[/h1]
You play as a little boy through a typical Monday on Kindergarten, you leave your bedroom and what's next is up to you. There is a LOT of different ways to "play" this game by how you take actions. Once you've tried "a new action" you get a hint to help you on your next day.
The goal is to help the other on the Kindergarten with tasks which end up with you getting a reward and an achievement. But beware, you might get killed on the way.

[h1]Is it worth buying it?[/h1]
Yes, no doubt. This game is for anyone who likes to sit for a longer time since the games is very addictive, well at least for me. You can choose between so many options and you always end the day (unless you hilariously die all of a sudden) with something new to work up with to finish the game. 

+ The game story was really good, I would definitely buy Kindergarten 2 if It comes out.
+ The music was making my game experience better, strange I know.
+ All characters was different which made the game perfect.
+ The game costs 5 bucks so It's worth spent.

Enough of me trying to explain the game, now go buy the game and enjoy your new pal, Nugget.

33782744.review:
If you're looking for a game review you've come to the wrong place. But if youre looking for a fantastic ravioli recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients
- To Make the Dough
375 grams (3 cups) plain flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 eggs
1/4 cup (50 ml / 3½ tablespoons) olive oil
1/2 cup (120 ml / 8 tablespoons) water
Extra flour for dusting 


- To Make Cheese Filling
15 ounces (425 grams) container Ricotta cheese
5 ounces (142 g/about 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons) "3 Cheese Italian Blend" (Parmesan, Romano & Asiago)
Note: grate these cheeses yourself and create your own custom blend.
1/2 cup cheddar cheese
2 eggs, lightly beaten
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper


- Extras
Your favorite sauce for the ravioli (i.e. marinara/ marijuana)
Parmesan cheese
Basil
Fried vegetables
Shrimp
Fish slices
Chicken pieces 
Make the Ravioli filling.

- In a small mixing bowl, add the ricotta and mash with a fork.
- Add in the 3-cheese blend, Cheddar cheese, eggs, salt, and pepper.
- Mix all ingredients thoroughly until you have a smooth, paste-like consistency.
- Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. 

Make the Ravioli dough.

- Crack eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat them with a fork. Add water, oil, and salt. Mix.
- Add 1 cup flour to the bowl. Use a fork to mix the flour with the eggs, water, oil, and salt. Repeat with the rest of the flour. Mix until a smooth dough is formed.
- Clear and clean off a large work surface and dust it with flour. This is where you are going to roll out your dough.
- Take the dough out of the mixing bowl, shape it into a ball, and place it on your work surface. Knead for at least 10 minutes or until it becomes elastic.
- Dust a rolling pin with flour to prevent the dough from sticking. Roll out the dough until it is about 1/8 inch (1/3 cm) thick, or about the thickness of 2 stacked quarters.
- With a cookie cutter or upside-down water glass, cut out circles in the dough (will make about 15-20 dough circles).
- Ball up the unused dough and either roll it out and make a couple more raviolis, or wrap it and put in the freezer for another time. Dough can keep for weeks when frozen. Just make sure to wrap well so that it doesn’t suffer from freezer burn or absorb freezer odor. 

Fill the Ravioli shells.

- Take the ravioli filling out of the refrigerator and place a tablespoon of it in middle of a dough.
- Fill a small bowl with water, dip your fingers in, and moisten around the outer edge of the dough circle.
- Fold the dough in half over the filling, making a half-moon shape. Be sure all the filling stays inside. Pinch the edges together and then seal the edges of the ravioli with a fork. Make sure to press firmly and go all the way around. This will add a “homemade” touch as well.
- Repeat this process for all your dough circles.
- Dust the finished ravioli with flour to keep them from sticking together. 

Form the Shells and Fill Using a Ravioli maker.

- Roll the dough into two sheets
- Place one sheet on the ravioli maker, and form the filling cups.
- Fill with the ravioli mixture.
- Lay the second sheet of dough on top, and roll it out. This will seal in the filling.
- Remove and separate the finished raviolis.

Cook the Ravioli.

- Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil.
- Place the ravioli in boiling water for 5-6 minutes, or until they float. You can also test for doneness by nibbling on the edges to test.
- If you don't want to make all the ravioli at one time, you can freeze the rest 
- Take ravioli out of boiling water with large slotted spoon and place on warmed plates

Serve it up.
Top with your favorite sauce, grate some fresh cheese over it, and enjoy!

33675272.review:
First of all, I want to say that this game is weird.

In a good way, though. It's creative, and unique, and like nothing you've ever seen before.

In Kindergarten, you play as a boy going to kindergarten. But, shortly after you'll discover that there is more to this game than just going to kindergarten. Perhaps you'll talk to the lonely little girl and discover that her brother has gone missing. Maybe you'll talk to the weird little boy and learn that the principal is handing out drugs. Maybe you'll talk to the janitor and learn... that he's a man of his word. Whatever you do, you should find out quickly that something is not right with this school.

Kindergarten is an adventure game... in a sense. The gameplay revolves around collecting and using objects in order to advance the various quests you get from characters around the school. Most of them have some quest you need to complete and rewards you with an item needed to complete another quest down the line, and the story, for the most part, is aimed at trying to uncover the mystery of what happened to the missing kid.

That being said, neither the gameplay nor the story, is really the reason to play this game. The reason to play it is the humor. A lot of it comes down to just how twisted this school really is. You could be playing house with one of you classmates, and the next thing you know, she'll be berating you for your alcoholism, and you'll be asking her for a divorce.

And, yes. Children can die in game. In fact, several of the quests require you to kill certain people around the school to progress. Which would be horrifying in a normal setting, but these children are not sweet and innocent by any stretch of the concept. Some are downright unapologetically cruel to the point where you want to see them die, and this mixed with the insanity of the setting and the clever way they're done leaves most of the death scenes still quite entertaining to watch... for the most part. A few deaths maybe go a bit far, but those are in the minority. Though it's also worth noting that the humor is also deeply rooted in the dialogue. It's usually worth looking through all the dialogue options just to see what sort of things people will say, and how they react to certain events.

Now, for those of you out there who think this makes the game sound too macabre, messed up, and shocking to be enjoyable... it really isn't. The cartoony pixel art graphics of the game keeps anything from getting too graphic, and there's no real prolonged suffering from anyone (with one exception)... just weird and whacky death scenes surrounded by genuinely funny dialogue.

I bought the game while it was in early access, and even back then, I realized that the game felt polished enough to be a full game if the developers just stopped updating it. And they haven't stopped yet, either, even though it's out of early access.

All in all, Kindergarten was a very enjoyable experience. The only real downside to me was that it involved a lot of trial and error, and one death was a bit too much... albeit that one particular death is actually avoidable. (when Cindy asks you to get something gross from the Janitor's closet, grab the note instead of the bucket... you'll thank me later) Still, despite the handful of flaws, this game is still very enjoyable to play through, and I highly recommend it.

33626948.review:
Just finished the game and I gotta say overall it's a solid 7/10 for me. Although it isn't long, there is a nice collection bonus that pads the run time -- that's actually rewarding to complete. The characters are whacky and you'll love and hate all of them in turn. If you're looking for a violent kindergarten similator -- or if that's something you never realized you needed until reading that phrase, dig in! 

So while the characters were fun and the story was interesting and rewarding to puzzle together, the game did have a few flaws. Namely the text. The text is humorous and brief--the first time. But when you go 4/5 on a character's storyline and want to blaze through / skip the dialogue you've already run through you're out of luck, more or less. You can speed up the text but skipping it is still a time muncher. Especially at the end, as I was finishing the card collection, resetting the days and going through the dialogue felt very tiresome. 

On a different note, the puzzles were almost without exception ridiculously easy to solve. However there was one that I encountered that stumped me for an exceptionally long time (Monty's storyline). That's when you really feel the burn of combing through dialogue repeatedly to get to all the different possibilities and finally find a solution. The reset room button helps this somewhat, but if you make a mistake and think you're okay to advance but that crucial item was in the room before it--you're out of luck. Have fun waiting through all the dialogue again.

So TL;DR:

Pro: Original, fun, funny, interesting characters, and a full circle storyline.
Con: If you get stuck you're in a dialogue nightmare of no escape

主角：姓名”狗蛋“   我暂时称他为狗蛋。狗蛋是一个典型的二五仔墙头草。风往哪吹往哪倒。是一个势利小人
女主：姓名“莉莉”   是逆来顺受被人欺辱却不敢反抗的，也是一种典型。社会中被欺压的对象。类似实习员工.临时工
女二：姓名“辛迪”   是一个典型的绿茶婊，与一般的绿茶婊不一样的是，她的行为是不加掩饰。喜欢欺负弱势群体。也很有虚荣心。从游戏里的细节可以看到，女二在一个星期换了7个男朋友。对于男主也是玩腻了就甩。而且刁蛮任性。任何有不顺心的就会迁怒男主。也特别喜欢把自己做的嫁祸给别人。
男二：姓名“那吉特”   是社会群体中的自闭群体。可能和家庭因素有关。有抑郁症 自闭症 内向。脑子也不太灵光。容易被孤立。也容易被人利用，欺骗。但是心肠还是不错的。
扛把子：姓名“巴格特”  孩子王,从小就遭遇了父母离异，父亲酗酒失踪。导致了在班级中会去欺辱他人，以寻求关注，吸引眼球。这种人现在也很常见。是一种家庭环境引发的心理疾病。偏执性的人格。具有暴力倾向
官二代：姓名“杰罗姆“ 是校长的儿子。在学校趾高气昂。欺负他人为乐，欺软怕硬。容易相信他人。被人当枪使。没有脑子。
智商担当：姓名“蒙蒂”在班级中与所有人都能有良好的关系，与领导老师可以周旋。在学校贩卖买卖东西。智商很高，情商也很高。但终究祸从口出。有些过于自负了。
班主任：姓名“波霸” 极其讨厌自己的学生，但表面确实一副道貌岸让的样子。只关心自己能否早点下班。对于任何事情都不在乎。嗑药上班的老师。
清洁工：姓名”我他妈也不知道“  心理变态。任何事情都不能违逆自己，一旦有不顺心的。就会把脾气发在那个人身上。极其自私自利。
校长：大反派。国内很多校长就是这样的。我就不说什么了

일단 유치원을 배경으로 컬트한 시도를 한것도 신기하지만 제법 스토리가 잘 짜였습니다.
뭐 대충보면 그냥 막장이지만 캐릭터들이 하는 행동은 과장되었지만 불합리하진 않죠.. 적어도 큰 틀에서는요.
기본적으로 많은 시행착오로 클리어하는 게임입니다. 흐릿하게나마 추리를 하고 거기에 맞춰서 답해야 하는 형식이죠. 다행이 영어가 그렇게 어려운 수준이 아닙니다.

많은 사람들이 유치원을 배경으로 이렇게 잔인한 연출이라는 점에서 불편함, 혹은 분노까지 느끼는 분들도 있겠지만 그냥 자극만을 위한 것은 아니라서 저는 추천하고 싶네요.

가격에 비해서 집중해서 할 수 있었고 퍼즐이 제법 머리를 써야하지만 그렇다고 답이 없는 막막한것도 아닙니다. 퍼즐 어드벤쳐로서 가장 좋아할만한 구성이에요. 지나치게 어렵지 않은 난이도와 스토리에 중심을 둔 재미라는 점에서 제 취향이라는건 확실하군요.

33470084.review:
This game actually surprised me. I saw a couple thumbnails of Youtubers playing this game and thought,"Eh, Ive got 10 dollars left in my wallet, I can always return it." SOOOOOO glad I didn't. The game starts out a bit odd if you dont know what your doing at first, but once you start to unlock the hints in game your direction and game choices become clearer and easier to follow. Whether your going to play for the Teacher and "eliminate" all other students, or be the best boyfriend ever, there is always something new and fun to do. The game also features a set of 25 small trading cards(called Monsterman Cards) and each one is earned by hunting them out or doing some VERY obscure and odd things that you would never do IRL(like, who goes back for thirds on Slop?!?!) The game is shorter than other games, I beat it with all the steam achieves in 5 or 6 hours with no online help(barring one time when i had no idea what "stab the bully and get his stash" meant). All in all I give it a 9/10 and would highly recommend playing this without watching any videos online first. 
P.S. Its mandatory that if you play the game the first thing that you do is PO the janitor and laugh your butt off with morbid laughter xD

33436293.review:
I really want to reccomend this game as it has clever puzzles and a unique setting and asthetic and we need more puzzle adventure games, but there are a few things holding it back. 

First the good: 
- Puzzles are for the most part fun and interesting
- The "groundhog day" mechanic makes for engaging gameplay
- The humor
- The creative setting
- The beginning is great, gives you a feeling of "anything could happen today"
- I played it to 100% completion. 

Now the bad:
- The humor. At first it's funny, like a particularly dark episode of South Park. But as the game drags on, you'll realize that the only type of humor you're going to see is shock humor. After awhile, it gets very predictable and loses its charm.
- The legnth. It's at once both too short and too long. While you can skip the letters filling a dialouge box, you still have to wait for the "confirm" button to appear, which means when you're mashing through conversations you've already seen 10 times it gets very uncomfortable and takes far too long. I completed this game in less than 6 hours, but I'm sure at least 1-2 of those were just mashing spacebar. That's not fun, and discourages experimentation.
- The difficulty and hint system. It's all over the place. Most of the time you see a hint appear in your notebook, you've already done what it hints at you doing. And other times (particularly with some monstermon cards) the hints are so vague as to be almost useless. Other times, the hint will reveal much more information than you need and make the puzzles trivial. So if you want a challenge, don't look at the hints. You don't need them for anything besides the cards anyway. 
- When it ends, you just think "Welp. That's it. Don't have to touch it again." Because you won't want to. Playing through the same day 20 times to get all of the cards makes you sick of the game.  Zero replayability value. 


Conclusion: Interesting premise with a few clever puzzles that is bogged down by slow text boxes with no skip button, predictible humor (with a few notable exceptions), and hand-holding hint system. Grab it on sale.

33417098.review:
Overall, Kindergarden is a better than average puzzle game. The story is interesting and genuinely engaging throughout. That being said, the puzzles fell into the category of either "too easy" or "too difficult" and once you have a feel for the actions that can be taken by interacting with the 9 different characters, the game become very easy to solve.

The $5 price tag is well worth it for this game, but anything more would begin to feel like a scam. The story, while great, is very short taking me roughly 2-3 hours to complete (less than an hour with a guide). Adittionally, there are a few minor bugs that could become irritating (sometimes animations wont trigger and chat options cannot be chosen), but other than that, the game runs pretty well.

There is virtually zero replay value as the solutions to the puzzles will always be the same which is also why the game gets easier the more you play, opposite of what you would expect in a puzzle game. Previously vague clues like "find a way to get sent to the principals office" become easier to solve after you've done it in the previous 2 puzzles.

My only real criticism is the hints system. Many of the hints only reveal themselves after you've figured out the solution OR after you've completed the character's quest, this does make parts of the game more difficult because you are essentially given no hints.

All in all, Kindergarden is a solid 8.5/10.

TL;DR:
Pros
- Interesting story
- Cheap
- Mentally engaging
- Few bugs (YMMV)

Cons
- Little replay value
- Short
- Difficulty scales backwards (puzzles get easier)
- Poor implementation of hint system

BUT, if you do or if you're on the fence, the story is wonderfully clever, the oddly lighthearted dark humor is genuinely whimsical (spoiler alert: I got a real laugh the first time I was unexpectedly shot), and the gameplay is solid.  It's an adventure game that tests your patience, but has more than enough story to make you want to 100% for the "good" ending, even while you curse at it.

33324445.review:
Kindergarten is a mostly entertaining, twisted little narrative that's priced about right. The dialogue stands out, the art serves its function and while you spend 95% of the game listening to a single music loop, it's somehow just the right amount of upbeat, catchy, and discordant with the chaos unfolding around it, while managing not to be grating. I did, pound for pound, enjoy it. So why the thumbs down?

[i](TLDR: A 'meh' ending and several design flaws that get worse the farther you play. The thumbs down is more to signal that this is a critical review if you're looking for counterpoints to unconditional praise.)[/i]

Because amidst a perhaps misrepresentatively overwhelming sea of positive reviews and what I [i]did[/i] enjoy about the game, there are some rather pronounced flaws in its framework that add up to [i]insane[/i] artificial inflation of playtime, and REALLY start to wear on you if you're going for the 100% ending. I want to highlight these for both anyone gauging their interest pre-purchase, and perhaps the devs too should they see this.

The first and biggest problem is that while some of the individual stories and characters are engaging, the overall narrative falls flat with an extremely predictable (regular) ending, an equally predictable and underwhelming secret ending that serves as little more than a sequel hook, and some characters' questlines (particularly Jerome's) feel artificial, existing for little more reason than to give you an unlock to further the narrative. Perhaps one of the more intriguing aspects of the game is that it takes place in a short groundhog loop which somehow allows you to save special items to use on subsequent loops, but neither the loop itself nor this exploitation of it are ever acknowledged or addressed in the story.

The second problem is that after you've run through the game a few times, you'll quickly feel your brain start to glaze over as you hammer through the dialogue trees you're familiar with. With how intensely dialogue-heavy the game is, it is EXTREMELY annoying to have to wait half a second or so between each line of dialogue you're allowed to skip. It doesn't seem like much, but consider that you'll probably go through a hundred-plus lines of dialogue on most runs and that adds up [b]fast.[/b] I feel like my 9 hours to complete the game could probably have been shortened to 5 or 6 if the text prompts were more prompt. On top of which the dialogue also ties into everybody's favourite...

The third problem: needlessly cryptic bullshit. You can [i]probably[/i] figure out enough of the game firsthand to get the regular ending without using guides, but the [i]utterly labyrinthine[/i] dialogue trees hide many more secrets than you would think. These are of course concealed by a literal minefield of "wrong answer and you die" or "lack an item and you die (but there's not always a hint that you COULD have survived with the right item)" situations. Such feats as unlocking playing card #3 would probably require an actual series of flowcharts to figure out yourself. There are "reset current room" and "reset day" options, the former of which is only of any use if you IMMEDIATELY realize you screwed up, as you'll frequently realize halfway through the day that you didn't bring enough cash to school and have to start over... or realize that you botched something in the [i]previous[/i] room which you cannot reset to... or you'll realize immediately that you messed up, but be thrust into the next room before you can reset. The difficulty curve is extremely uneven with the first few questlines available to you actually being some of the most complex to finish. To its credit, the game features a built-in hint system that gradually unlocks tips for advancing based on certain flags as you attempt, succeed, and fail to complete certain tasks. Unfortunately...

The fourth problem: the game is still kind of buggy. You're unlikely to hit any real showstoppers, but aside from mostly cosmetic stuff like some characters referring to others as though they were in Condition A when they are in Condition B, a surprising number of the all-important hints never seem to unlock by attempting, failing, or stumbling around the task to which they refer, and will only unlock [b]retroactively after you have already completed the relevant task.[/b] Some of the hints are also decidedly unhelpful, such as telling you you have to shank Character C during X time of day, without [i]any[/i] indication of the crazy web of events and dialogue trees you may never have even seen to get the prompt for that to appear.

Like I said, I still enjoyed it. It was worth a few bucks. The flaws aren't that pronounced, until you hit a stopping point and don't always have much to go on to figure it out. When that happens, though, it gets aggravating fast.

33311990.review:
这是一款非常有意思的文字类游戏，根据你的选择不同故事会有不同的进展。由于游戏中一天的行动次数是有限的，如何合理安排一天当中有限的时间对喜欢动脑的玩家是一个非常棒的问题。
把这样一个黑暗的故事设定在幼儿园中可以说的作者的恶趣味，也可以说是一种特殊的荒诞幽默。
另外这也是一个搜集类型的游戏，游戏中各种不同对话，以及数量众多的搜集卡片，都能让有搜集癖的玩家充分游玩。
关于游戏的tip：
一、请留心游戏菜单中的HINT，虽然有些HINT在触发后才会解锁，但也有一些是会提前解锁的，这些HINT对游戏的进行还是有一定帮助的。
二、卡片搜集齐之后可以获得开启隐藏结局的道具，一般而言按照流程完成游戏应该不会在打通普通结局前完成全搜集，而完成所有主线后会为玩家提供所有卡牌的获得方式（HINT），所以在完成所有主线之前请放心进行主线剧情吧，之后再进行卡片搜集也为时未晚。
三、所谓的隐藏结局其实比起结局更像是个彩蛋，如果能够理解这款游戏的恶趣味和荒诞幽默的话，相信也能领会这个作者精心准备的“玩笑”结局。[spoiler]其实我还是挺期待kindergarten2的[/spoiler]

美中不足的是尽管作者已经完善了大部分玩家可能作出的奇葩选择的组合，仍有部分情况下各个角色的行为并不会使故事显得合理，甚至存在极少量可能导致游戏卡死必须重新开始房间的bug，不过考虑到这款游戏的选择肢的丰富程度，我觉得这些问题的存在也可以理解。我相信游戏作者也会尽量修补这些问题。（笔者写下这篇评测时该游戏版本为V1.1）

如果在游戏中遇到任何困难，可以参考社区中已有的攻略，攻略写得非常完整。也可以在网上搜寻攻略视频，一些国人已经制作了非常完备的全流程攻略视频。如果游戏过程中针对游戏内容遇到了一些疑难问题，也欢迎留言咨询探讨，自认为已经完整游玩了整个游戏，应该能够给出一些有用的提示或见解。

很（有趣）的游戏。很重要的一点 使用游侠汉化可以正常解锁成就。
ps：忽然发现很多人点了差评。那么，首先看第一句话，如果你听从我的建议使用了游侠汉化来解锁成就，并且点了差评。我只想说，呵呵呵。
在玩这个游戏的时候就在想。为了什么？
其实是偶然看了个主播的视频，只看了一点点，鄙人从不看人打游戏。
我认为这游戏不值16，还是打折时期16，虽然过程算是有趣。
在我看来，这个剧情就是没有剧情。扮演着一个会重复穿越和所有脑残角色虚与委蛇的角色，到底算什么剧情？
PS2:如果你觉得在全篇无梗的情况下，看着你被人用拖把怼死，或者看着NPC之间没理由的杀害会感到有趣的话。我对这种人不想做任何评价。横向对比south park。
重复的完成同一个对话。没有加速和跳过功能。看起来内容饱满只有可怜的几个小场景。
PS3:横向对比任何早期多线GAL。
作画粗糙，不是喜不喜欢像素游戏的问题，而是这个游戏只有66M。像素游戏作画也可以很精致。
1.无汉化。2.无剧情可言，如果你说这种无厘头负面的灌屎也算剧情。3优化很差，手柄移动很难受，会滑步。4.过于繁琐的重复操作和对白。也许你会觉得这种多选项的游戏很有意思，但是重复几十次肯定很有趣。5.差劲的画质。
PS4：我不打算退款。首先对视频通关的兄弟说声醒醒，你喜欢什么UP主就去看，撑死了是个看别人玩游戏的，连玩家都算不上，游戏也不是他做的，连游戏都没买追着我加好友不是搞笑么（此乃本人猜测，实在第三句话都懒得回）？其次我说的句句实话，这个剧情说明了什么道理（正面意义），有意见的麻烦在留言里写清楚。最后本评测仅仅提供给不知道如何处理汉化的人和打算购买这款游戏的人。如果是后者，我建议他去看看南方公园和传说之下。
以上。

Other than that it's a great title.... good job guys. I loved it.

33152299.review:
I picked this up on a whim, thinking... hell, can't be awful for $4. Then I wound up getting four hours of gameplay out of it!

The game is deceptively simple: you're stuck in a Groundhog Day-style loop, reliving the same Monday over and over. Every day there are phases: before school, morning class, lunch, recess, and show & tell. Your mission is to try to figure out how to uncover the weird stuff going on at the school.

When you complete one of the NPC's storylines, you unlock a permanent item that stays with you when the day loops over. As you complete more and more of the NPC quests, you'll get more and more items. Then you'll have to use those items in order to finally beat the game.

It's dead simple, but the "same day" loop makes this feel very much like a puzzle game. How do you get that one character to be in a certain room at lunch? How do you ensure somebody will have the item you need by recess? How can you earn as much money as possible before the day ends? Though it's simple, the adventure/puzzle aspect of the game really works.

The writing is funny, the characters are absurdly over the top. Gore and cursing and abortion and drug abuse and more. The game is definitely not for kids, but it doesn't really feel like it's trying too hard.

33141301.review:
I recommend this with certain caveats. I love time loops and the information gain from them. I was also able to beat the entirety of the game in my listed time with only needing a guide for 2 parts, Monty's mission and collecting all of the cards after I beat the main story. 

The Good
The game is a fun mix of characters and ridiculous violence that contrasts the setting of a kindergarten. On top of that, you have interesting mysteries with some good hints that help you along the way to figuring out how to complete each individual character's storyline. I enjoyed my experience and found figuring out the patterns and other such to be worth my time, even for those frustrating moments.

The Bad
I say I recommend with certain caveats because of the bad parts of my experience. The hint system is nice when it works and downright infuriating when it doesn't. The fact that for the Monty quest it mentions the chocolate bar is a red herring and frustrates me to no end that I couldn't figure out how to get it cheaper and then, upon looking up a guide, found that it wasn't necessary to get the amount of money you need. The card hints are atrocious as you can't tell what cards you have what cards you haven't collected. So I used a method where I didn't remove the "new hint" from the cards I hadn't collected until I picked them up with the guide. Another negative for the hint system is that some hints are unlocked via dialogue and others through actions you have to have performed once to get the hint. So if you've not performed the action, you might be unaware that something exists (I'm looking at you again, Monty's quest)

Another frustration comes from the need to actually do runs where all I'm doing is collecting money to get to the arbitrary max of $10 so I can do other runs which usually require a few dollars to complete. Why is there a max for the piggy bank? Why not just make a max of what you can bring so that on the runs I collect more money, I don't have to waste my time just collecting money because the quest I'm on this run requires me to have $3 to make all the necessary purchases or have enough for the bully.

Final Result: Recommended because of its low price and entertainment value. If you like time loop type stories where you capitalize on the gain of information from run to run, you'll really enjoy this. Just be careful of those moments of frustration where you realize you needed to bring more money, restart the day, and realize you don't have enough and have to waste a run collecting money.

Edit: I will note that I beat the entire game, including the extra collectables and bonus ending in what steam is listing as 4 hours. Take that into account when purchasing if gameplay time is important to your purchasing considerations.

Kindergarden es un juego de aventura (que puedes jugar con tu control de XBOX desde la comodidad de tu sofa!) donde juegas como un chamaco en una escuela de locos. Una maestra adicta a las drogas, un director pistolero que le gusta "callar" a niños fisgones con una bala. Un concerje enamorado de su trapeador con bolsas que escurren sangre en el baño y los otros niños no se quedan detras.

Repitiendo el mismo dia una y otra vez, cada vez que acabes el dia sabras de mas cosas que hacer y tendras otra oportunidad de hacer las cosas diferentes para descubrir los secretos mas perturbadores de este kinder.

Kindergarden tiene buenas sorpresas oscuras y gran dialogos (en ingles) con una historia un poco mejor de lo regular. De hecho, lei que ya esta disponible totalmente en español!

Lo unico malo es que es un juego super corto (yo lo acabe al 100% en 6 horas), pero que 6 horas!

Si les gustan los juegos de aventura. Definitivamente comprenlo si esta en oferta o en menos de 8 USD.

Ya con todo, a este juego le doy 87 nuggets de pollo de 100 de Nugget.

游戏品质说好了
看看游戏内容，这个幼儿园真他娘不简单
小小年纪的孩子，就交起男朋友,仗着自己强欺负别人，贩卖香烟
还有校长 老师，清洁工以及食堂大妈。一个枪毙学生，一个用拖把穿死学生，一个心机满满看任何一个学生都不爽。一个只给小孩吃泥糊
那些小孩象征了在校园暴力和早恋，还有一个是在校园时刻被欺凌的弱小者
哇真的很讽刺，因为我智商低，词穷，这里就没什么好写了


说说结局（剧透警报！












真结局里是主角带着25张小卡片去nugget的友谊洞穴里面召唤了什么不得了的东西
然后上去的时候天色变红，闪电杀死了所有在场的人
这也是报复了所有校园霸陵者
但是留下了他和主角
也许主角才是真正能给他安慰的人，他说billy失踪后再也感受不到爱和友谊。

32970160.review:
i became aware of this game after seeing that a few youtubers started playing it, and was tempted to watch them just to see what it was like. but I decided that it would probably be best to play it blind and just see where it goes, and oh my god did this game surprise me. and i would recommend you do the same if you find yourself curious, because here is a perfect example of a game that just has to be played for yourself. it will not be fun at all to know all the answers going into it. and on that note, this review might have some spoilers, so play the game first before reading onwards.

somehow this game manages to cram as many things into it as possible without feeling like the devs just tried to lazily piece something together and push it onto steam, and every mechanic is just cranked up to 150%. this game will kill you in more crazy and unfair ways than Dark Souls. this game includes more illegal activity and crime than a GTA game. this game will have you reseting the game to try different choices more than Undertale. and this game's humor feels like the perfect love child between South Park and a Lego game. not to mention that each character has their own destinct personality that you immediately latch onto within the first half hour. this game nailed everything it was going for presentation-wise. i did notice though that some details are a tiny bit off, and as a guy who has been coding for about a year now, it leads me to believe this is somebody's early work, or even first game. and if it is, dude keep it up, this is fantasic and the industry needs more devs like you around.

the story goes like this. you are one of 8 students attending a local kindergarten. one of them has mysteriously gone missing, and the others pretty much want nothing to do with you, a lot like going to actual school. you them discover that the janitor and the principal have been up to some weird stuff... weird, murder-y, type stuff. you them have to assist each of the 6 other students so they give you special items that help you progress further. these tasks will vary from "oh so thats what i need to do!" to flat out rage inducing. you sometimes need to elaborately murder students, or teachers, and most of the time you will be dodging dialog options that kill you and make you restart. yeah, this game gets pretty messed up. and one point you even have to pour blood on somebody's head.

now onto the actual gameplay. as I said, you will be restarting more times than Undertale, because this game is 90% triggering certai events in the right order to yeild the right results. you could find yourself reseting the same day 20 times just to learn you didnt grab enough money at the start of the game, of there was an item you needed to pick up, or you could have simply chosen the wrong dialog and strayed to the wrong path, forcing you to start over. it gets frustrating beyond belief, but in a good way. every step closer you get to the correct path feels more and more rewarding. for one quest you need to save up $20 in one day, and various events can give you more money, but if you arent sure exactly which ones to trigger, you will have just wasted a day and will have to try all over again. you only get to trigger 5 events per room, and sometimes getting items or moneycould take up 2, 3, or even 4 event triggers. sometimes you need to rigger an event in an earlier room just to have the right item to be able to trigger enough events in a later room. its very trial-and-error based, it forces you to experiment with possibilities, which is why i recommend playing it blind. knowing all the answers will ruin the fun.

for some additional notes, this game has full controller support, but it really is up to you which feels more comfortable to use, which is a nice touch. the graphics are simple, you could argue that theyre bad, but i personally loved the style. and there some collectables hidden in the game for all you completionists.

Gameplay: 7/10
-there really isnt much to be said other than what I stated before. its fun by all means, but Kindergarten is by no means a gameplay driven game. the choices do make for a lot of great possibilities though.

Story: 8/10
you replay the exact same day over and over again with only special items and money being saved. this removed the risk of permanent consequences and allows you to relive dozens of insane stories. there is a definitive ending though, so dont worry about that.

Humor: 8.5/10
each character is messed up in their own right, and you cant help but laugh along with it. this game was in no way meant ot be taken seriously. even the name itself "Kindergarten" is its own sick joke.

Graphics: 7/10
pixel graphics with some amatuer although nice visuals.

---------------------------

Overall: 9/10
kindergarten is that perfect blend of insanity, violence, and humor that is great for a good kick. its the brilliantly crafted gems like this that are what make the indie game community shiny. i would highly recommend it

这游戏推荐还是推荐的，整个解密过程非常连贯，细节处理的也不错，幽默与荒诞感十足。其他测评也吹过一波了我就不多说了，想说说缺点。这游戏最大的缺点就是拖时间…
1.只能重开房间或回家。虽然游戏有提示，但是没刷过完整的线就不知道中途会发生什么，道具可以靠提示，但是缺少钱和行动点就很尴尬了，这个时候还必须重来，需要精确规划好。万一理解不对或哪里又出了岔子，又得重来。这种枯燥的重复降低游戏体验感，希望作者能完善下倒退系统，便于玩家规划。
2.卡片的设定。这个卡片虽然不是正统结局但是一回家就被一堆卡片包围，就算不是强迫症也想把卡片凑齐的啊！要是只是散落在各地还相对好说，无非就再收集一下粗心遗漏的，但是它偏得穿插在剧情里。这等于说要为了全收集卡片再过一段冗长的剧情！这个设定完全就是为了拖时间而存在的吧？？？？
综上，流程短我是不介意的，拖时间就不好了影响游戏体验。

32831243.review:
Really fun game filled with hilarious dialogue. 

There's a lot of little quests to do, but you technically only get one day to do them: The day starts as Monday, do whatever you want, the day ends. The next day is Monday x2; it's like Groundhog day, but you keep whatever items/money you collected that day which is stored in your room.

The gameplay is repetitive (you're repeating days), but you choose different dialogue/actions to try and complete different quests. The puzzles are complex, but the game has a "Hints" menu to help guide you a bit. If you mess up, you can either restart the entire day, or you can restart the current room/class period you're in which is really helpful.

My only complaint is that there's no "Skip Dialogue" button; dialogue can be a little long sometimes and it'd be nice to skip it especially when you've heard the same lines 50 times.

The main quests took me about 5 hours; I still have cards I could collect. Definitely a fun little game for $5. Don't think I'd play it from scratch again, but would love to watch friends play and see their reactions.

32830171.review:
Questo indie è uno dei migliori rompicapo che abbia mai visto, comprende una serie di quest più o meno complesse per ogniuno dei 6 personaggi,posso assicurarvi che vi intrigherà molto soprattutto quando,per arrivare ad un obbiettivo, dovrete intrecciare le quest, anche se il tema e il titolo lo fanno sembrare un gioco "per bambini" noterete fin da subito tutte le cose inquietanti di questo asilo, il gioco è solido e non pecca quasi in niente,completandolo al 100% non ho trovato bugs e i tempi morti erano dati solo dal mio continuo ripetere qualcosa per colpa di un MIO errore.Una trama ai limiti del nosense e moltissimi dialoghi, modificabili tramite le scelte , porteranno a stuzzicare la fantasia; per rendere più facili le quest c'è un menù apposito per gli indizi.Oltre alle quest principali ci sono ben 25 carte,se le collezionerete tutte e le porterete in un certo luogo potrete accedere a un easter egg.Non mentirò nel dire che per finire questo gioco ho nerdato come un ossessionato proprio oggi.Vi consiglio vivamente di non farvi spoiler e di non guardare nessuna guida, al massimo vi concedo di guardarne una per le carte.
infine c'è da dire che, per comprendere a pieno e riuscire nel gioco servirà una conoscenza (piuttosto basilare) del gioco, io non ho avuto problemi ma non consiglierei di giocarci a qualcuno che non conosce decentemente l'inglese.
Io consiglio vivamente l'acquisto soprattutto ora che è in sconto ;).

32816348.review:
[b]Das Spiel unterteilt sich in 5 Phasen die an einem Tag verteilt sind. Die Tage wiederholen sich. Man spielt also immer dasselbe? Nicht ganz.[/b]
Je nachdem mit welchen Personen man wie interagiert, welche Gegenstände man ihn vorherigen Phasen mitgenommen hat, ändert sich die Spielsituation. Die Aktion pro Phase sind begrenzt, deshalb ist man gezwungen jeden Tag öfters durchzuspielen um die Geschichte und die Charakter voll und ganz auszukosten. Dabe habe ich aber nie Langeweile oder Eintönigkeit verspürt. 
Die Hintergrundgeschichte ist zwar recht plump, aber die übetriebenen Charakter des Kindergartens machen das alle mal wett. 
Die Musik ist stimmig und passt gut zu diesem einzigartigen Setting. Vor allem gefällt mir, dass alle Charaktere im Takt der Musik wippen.

Für 5 € hatte ich da ganz schön Spaß! Und wer ein Happy End möchte, sollte alles Monsterkarten einsammeln ;)

32805442.review:
I bought this during the Steam Summer Sale and to be quite honest, I did not expect to enjoy this game as much as it did. I felt as if I laughed more than I should have with its dark humor and gory-ish scenes. But this was a nice change of pace for me since I normally play FPS games. Mixed with a type of comedy and puzzle game, it was great playing even though it did not last very long. One downside I had was how repetetive the game can get. It's just a minor reason, but it got annoying once and a while each time I mess up and had to restart. This isn't much of a problem but more of a preference, but I disliked how I couldn't use the D-Pad on my controller to move around. It's such a small issue, but it bothered me because I don't really use the analog sticks for movement unless it's a racing game. I'm currently trying to get a 100% completion with the achievements and such.
Overall, I'd rate this game an 8/10 because of the pure enjoyment I got out of it.

[SPOILERS]

One thing I thought was difficult for this game was how confusing everything would get in each quest. I eventually had to resort to finding a walkthrough to get through some levels, such as getting [spoiler]The Secret Device[/spoiler] from the [spoiler]Principle[/spoiler] for Nugget's mission or [spoiler]getting enough money[/spoiler] for Monty to [spoiler]make the key[/spoiler] on his mission. I think in the future I will make my own walkthrough of the decisions I made in the game because I know everyone does it differently and also since the game has been updated.

I'm split to be honest, but I did enjoy the time I put into it so I'll give it a recommendation.  

The problem is the repetition, to play the game honestly you pretty much just try to focus on one character's questline.  Eventually you'll realize you messed up somewhere and restart the day and try to figure out what you did wrong.  It's like Dark Souls but the enemies are conversations.  Think ahead, remember details from previous runs.  Personally I was going crazy at times because I'd get a little further and then realize I was supposed to buy a certain item here or talk to someone else previously.  So I admit I used a guide at a couple spots, and then got extremely lucky on some choices at the end.  

So honestly the game's fault was my own impatience, however it is funny and rewarding when you figure out stuff on your own, so if you don't mind repeition and trial and error this might be for you.  There's a lot of collectables which would require even more reptition but they also switch things up a bit so there is some incentive to go for them.

32742748.review:
Kindergarten é um jogo estranho. Em resumo, você está preso num loop temporal onde sempre será segunda-feira, e deve interagir com os personagens ao longo do dia na pré-escola, e de acordo com as suas interações, você terá uma história diferente. Ao fim do dia você pode obter cartas e itens especiais dependendo de como as coisas andaram, e então você repete tudo de novo, podendo agir diferente de acordo com o que aprendeu anteriormente. Apenas o dinheiro, itens especiais e monstermon cards são retidos quando você "reseta" o dia. Estes itens especiais te ajudam a levar a história de forma diferente nos dias seguintes.

Se você possui um senso de humor duvidoso e paciência, será muito divertido tentar diferentes possibilidades de história: você pode dedurar colegas (e matá-los), ser um bom menino e ajudar seus coleguinhas, ou ainda planejar a morte da professora, e por aí vai...

Não é nenhuma obra-prima, mas diverte por um tempo. Aconselho a comprar quando estiver em promoção.

32626834.review:
For its asking price, Kingerdarten is a great little puzzle adventure game. Its core mechanic revolves around repeating the same day over and over again in order to complete a series of tasks in the correct order. 

When hearing about this game, I thought the gimmick would grow old and frustrating fast. Luckily, the short duration of days and the huge amount of hints given to the player make it very fun and encouraging to try new things to get different results. Its wacky and try-hard offensive humor also makes it really fun to play and mess around. I only wish that you could more quickly skip through dialogue and cutscenes, as it can become really tiring seeing the same ones over and over again, especially if you're going for all the collectibles. 

Kindergarten is a great, funny, and fun little puzzle game that anyone could easily get lost in for a few hours. Can't wait to see Nugget again in Kindergarten 2!
